name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
This proclamation reflects the vision and compromises of local officials, veterans, sportsmen, environmental groups, and so many others. 

The result is a victory for Colorado’s environment, our outdoor economy, and the legacy of public lands we owe the next generation.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
After the war, many veterans returned to Colorado to build our ski and outdoor industries. 

Theirs is an extraordinary story - a deeply Colorado story - of service, vision, entrepreneurship, and an abiding connection to the outdoors and our public lands.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
In 1945, the skills of 10th Mountain made history at Riva Ridge, where they climbed over 1,800 ft up a vertical cliff in the dead of night to dislodge Axis soldiers from the high ground.

Their heroism helped break the German line and clear the way for Victory in Europe.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
It also honors the legacy of the 10th Mountain Division. During World War II, 15K soldiers from across the country came here.

Some had never seen snow or been in the mountains. But over two years of relentless training, they became the world’s most capable mountain soldiers.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
Its history goes back to before Colorado was even a state. 
According to the tribal history of the Ute people, their ancestors lived here “since the beginning of time.” This designation honors their enduring connection to the land and their rightful role in helping to manage it.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
This is a historic day for Colorado, and I want to thank @GovofCO, @RepJoeNeguse, @SenatorHick, @SecVilsack and so many others for their leadership to make it possible.

This designation means more Americans will come to appreciate the extraordinary history of Camp Hale.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: The bill creates a fee on methane pollution from the oil and gas industry, a greenhouse gas many times more powerful than carbon dioxide. I’ve spent years advocating for stronger federal protections to cut methane, drawing on our leadership in Colorado. (9/12)

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
It includes $14B for rural clean energy. That includes $10B for rural electric cooperatives, like CO's @TriStateGT, & more for rural small businesses, ag producers, public power utilities & others.

It'll lower energy costs & create clean energy jobs in rural communities. (8/12)

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: It includes 3 of my bills to boost US manufacturing for wind & solar energy components, along with next-generation batteries to power electric vehicles and our energy grid to create good-paying jobs & reduce our dependence on foreign imports from nations like China. ☀️⚡️🔋 (7/12)

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: And it includes my proposal to ensure those credits can be accessed for the first time ever by entities without tax liability, like rural electric cooperatives, public power utilities, & Tribes. It'll create a powerful incentive to accelerate our transition to clean energy.(6/12)

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: The bill creates long-term tax credits to accelerate clean energy deployment, which will provide much-needed certainty and move us away from the boom and bust cycles that have plagued the industry for years. (5/12)

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: It permanently funds support for coal miners who’ve suffered from black lung disease. They worked for years putting their health at risk to power our economy, and America needs to be there for them now. I was glad to sponsor this bill with @Sen_JoeManchin. (4/12)

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
It also extends a tax credit to help over 150,000 Coloradans afford their health care premiums, something @SenatorHick and I pushed to include in this bill.
 
Through these credits, our state received $74 million in 2021 to help lower health care costs for Coloradans. (3/12)

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: The bill requires Medicare to negotiate drug prices on behalf of the American people. It will save seniors thousands of dollars, and save the country billions of dollars. This was a pillar of my Medicare-X bill back in 2017. 💊🏥💵(2/12)

So today, let's celebrate our democracy and recommit to making it better.

On behalf of Colorado, we thank him for his continued service. https://t.co/QNYV9664lS

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
💧Water Infrastructure🥤
 
Access to clean water is a fundamental human right.
This bill provides robust funding for water infrastructure in the West and for Tribal communities.

Read more about my Tribal Access to Clean Water Act with @MartinHeinrich --->
https://t.co/UwKxcis6EA

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
🌎Building Climate Resilience🌍
 
This bill is a good initial investment in climate resilience projects. It includes my proposals for:
 
🏭Carbon Capture Private Activity Bonds
 
🛢️Programs to plug, remediate, and reclaim orphaned wells on federal, state, and Tribal lands

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
🔥Support for Wildfire Recovery🌲

Wildfires continue to tear through CO. This bill passed with my amendment to authorize the Joint Chiefs program to reduce wildfire risk.

It also includes $300M for the Emergency Watershed Protection program to support wildfire recovery efforts.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
🖥️Expanding Access to Broadband💻
 
Colorado will receive a minimum of $100 million to help provide broadband coverage across the state. This comes from a provision based on my BRIDGE Act which makes a historic federal investment in broadband. https://t.co/jjqKrVUjJI

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
Colorado will see:
 
🛣️$3.7B for highway projects.
🌉$225M for bridge replacement and repairs.
🚈$917M to improve public transportation.
🔌$57M to support the expansion of an electric vehicle charging network throughout the state.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
The bipartisan #InfrastructureBill we passed today invests in the traditional infrastructure we desperately need, like roads and bridges.

And it also begins to prioritize infrastructure that is necessary in modern America.

Here is some of what I fought to include for Colorado⤵️

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: Scott Miller has been a steadfast champion for equal rights and opportunity in Colorado and across the country. With his demonstrated commitment to our highest ideals, Scott will make an exceptional U.S ambassador to Switzerland. https://t.co/0iZv6D9uJ1

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: We have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to build an economy that works for everyone and address our biggest challenges, like economic inequality, the threat of climate change, and a rising China.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: But we need to do more to invest in the Colorado families, workers, and kids that traditionally have been an afterthought in Washington.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
Over the last several years, the American people have lost faith in the Senate’s ability to come together and accomplish anything meaningful.

Today, for the first time in a long time, we made a historic investment to build 21st century infrastructure and create good-paying jobs.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
Washington has not invested in working families for decades. Instead, Congress has cut taxes by $5 trillion for the wealthiest Americans since 2001.

But finally, we now have an opportunity to invest in the American people, in our infrastructure, and in our children. https://t.co/TnbVvVIwsj

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
For kids today, not having access to broadband is like not having access to textbooks.

The historic broadband investment in the #InfrastructureBill — based on my BRIDGE Act — helps ensure that kids today can access the tools they need to succeed in school. https://t.co/yRcfdEvxTd

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
Monday checklist:

Preside over the Senate: ✔️

Follow public health recommendations: ✔️

Invest in 21st century, American infrastructure: Almost there. https://t.co/ftGv1lkRqJ

name: Michael Bennet

name: Michael Bennet

name: Michael Bennet

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
It's a stain on our Republic that many Tribal communities still lack access to clean water. I’m glad the #InfrastructureBill mirrors our legislation to help ensure access to this fundamental human right.

It’s the first of many actions needed to fulfill this unmet responsibility.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
U.S. competition with China is about more than our economies: it's a competition between democracy on one hand & totalitarianism on the other.

But I'm optimistic. Because when it's working well, we  — and other democracies around the world — ultimately have a much better system. https://t.co/KV4JtwVEMQ

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
56 years ago on this day, America passed the #VotingRightsAct. But it's no time to celebrate. Our democracy is under attack, and we must get to work:

By making it easier, not harder, to vote. 
By banning partisan gerrymandering.
By driving dark money out of politics.

Onward.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:

Let’s keep building on this commitment to compete with China's EV market and meet our climate goals. https://t.co/ohqwBZjnLQ

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
As devastating wildfires tear through the West, we must invest in restoring our forests.

That's why I'm glad our #REPLANTAct was included in the #InfrastructureBill. It will help the @forestservice plant 1.2 billion trees to restore our forests while creating thousands of jobs.

name: Michael Bennet

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: America will never heal until we fully confront and dismantle systemic racism in this country. As we celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, let’s rise to the example of leaders like Frederick Douglass, Fannie Lou Hamer, and Dr. King by working to make our country what it ought to be.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
But this cannot be something we discuss for only one month. 

Every day, we must commit to acting on the fair and overdue demands of those who protested and demonstrated in Colorado and across the country last summer and throughout history.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: At each juncture in our history, Black Americans have fought to make our country more democratic, more fair, and more free. Every February, #BlackHistoryMonth is an opportunity for us to honor and build on the extraordinary contributions Black Americans have made to our country.

name: Michael Bennet

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
The purpose of direct action, Dr. King reminds us, is “to create such a tension that a community which has constantly refused to negotiate is forced to confront the issue.”
 
That’s what happened in Colorado, when we became the first state to pass police accountability reform.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
In today's news cycle, we hear politicians & pundits lecturing about “law and order” & “disturbing the peace”—but they seem to have no appreciation of the injustice people are trying to disturb.

It was no different than when Dr. King was writing from his jail cell in Birmingham.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
George Floyd. Breonna Taylor. Jacob Blake. Darrell Mitchell. Elijah McClain.

What happened to them would never happen to me or my daughters. 
 
Until that's no longer true, we must continue to take what Dr. King called direct action. https://t.co/uVym5GzkgP

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text:
We will never heal as a country until we fully confront and dismantle the systemic racism that plagues every aspect of our society. 

As a white male and a United States Senator, it is my duty to use my platform and position to do this.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: This week, I returned to work in a capitol building whose stones were placed by enslaved human beings. American slavery is not ancient history. Our country enslaved human beings less than a hundred years before I was born in 1964.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: You can draw a straight line from slavery to Jim Crow to the redlining of our banking and housing systems to mass incarceration to the recent killing of black people from Georgia to Minnesota.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: If you have been paying any attention, if you have listened to voices in the black community and studied our history, then you know these injustices have been with us for generations and grown worse in recent decades.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: In recent days, many have observed that the current pandemic has exposed profound inequality in our society. We should not have needed a pandemic to see this.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: What happened to George Floyd would never happen to my daughters. It would never happen to me. That is the reality we face, the reality thousands are protesting in Colorado and across the country, and the reality we must change.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: When I worked for the City and County of Denver, one of the first tragedies we confronted was the unjustified shooting of a black teenager named Paul Childs by law enforcement in Park Hill. That was almost 20 years ago. Nothing has changed.

tweet_text: It’s been one week since the world watched Minneapolis police kill George Floyd. You cannot watch the video without feeling sick, without remembering Ahmaud Arbery, Breonna Taylor & the countless other Americans who have lost their lives in this country because they were black.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: After the war, veterans of the 10th used their Camp Hale experience to help launch the outdoor recreation industry and inspire generations of Coloradans.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: During World War II, the Army built Camp Hale to train the 10th Mountain Division in specialized winter mountain warfare. The soldiers who trained at Camp Hale would go on to lead a series of victories against German troops in the Italian Alps.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: We must stand up for people like Lu and DACA recipients across America in the face of this administration's heartless attacks. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: She'll only be able to continue her essential work as a nurse if she can renew her DACA status.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: Lu now works at a hospital in Denver, and is about to complete her second degree in Nursing. Her goal is to become an emergency room nurse and a teacher to future nurses.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: She focused on her education and graduated with a degree in Molecular Biology and Genetics. After being granted DACA status, Lu was able to pursue opportunities in the health care field, and after working as an EMT for years, she fell in love with caring for others.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: In search of better work and educational opportunities, Lu’s parents brought her to the U.S. when she was 13. After years of trying to obtain legal residency, she and her family became undocumented.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: As we think about the Americans whose lives could be upended by the looming #DACA SCOTUS decision, Lu’s story is one of countless stories to share.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: But we have so much more work to do – and that starts with treating mental health as an essential part of health care, funding it as such, and prioritizing it in the next #COVID19 relief package.

name: Michael Bennet
tweet_text: Yesterday’s Senate passage of my bill to designate 9-8-8 as the suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline was a strong step toward making mental health support more accessible to Americans, and I’ll keep pushing until this bill becomes law.
